definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: In some European countries a huge amount of goods shipped between the inland waterway transport.
sentences.chinese: 在一些欧洲国家间装运巨量货物的内河运输。

sentences.english: The stock market in great quantity undersells under the pressure, stops the rising trend.
sentences.chinese: 股市在巨量抛售压力下，止住上升势头。

sentences.english: It involves a huge amount of consumer testing.
sentences.chinese: 这涉及到巨量的消费者测试。

definition: high position/eminent status/top job/raised position/upper (limbs)/a high (i.e. local maximum)/high point on scale, high grade, temperature, latitude etc
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
(Tw) to pull sth up/(fig.) to give a boost to/to support
to take money or valuables out of storage/to recover/to ship goods/to extract (chemicals from solution)
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
